text: Louver/grille type and model matches mechanical/equipment schedule
Louvers tested per AMCA/ASHRAE for free area, pressure drop, and water infiltration
Finish (e.g., anodized, powder coat) and color match architectural elevations
Accessories (bird screen, insect screen, blank-offs) received and match submittals
Framed or masonry opening level, plumb, square
Flashing, sill pan, and air barrier tie-ins prepped prior to install
Coordination with mechanical and cladding trades complete before install
Louver frame fastened with anchors per manufacturer’s recommendation
Bird/insect screens installed on interior side (unless specified otherwise)
Interior duct or exhaust connections secured and aligned
Multi-section louvers aligned for uniform reveals, depth, and spacing
Continuous flashings and trim pieces installed between joined sections
Decorative/architectural grilles aligned and secured against wind rattle
Free air opening confirmed per design (ducting or building automation reviewed if required)
Water test or pressure performance tested (if required by consultant/spec)
Manufacturer’s warranty and closeout documentation submitted
